cluster_relations.rel_desc: Urban legends are disseminated across continents.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates the spatial or audience scope that an information item, story, or legend reaches or is disseminated to (e.g., continents, global audience).
cluster_relations.object_class_label: Geographic Scales of Urban Legend Spread

cluster_relations.rel_desc: New forms and variations of legends are distributed across continents.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that a legend or its variations are present and circulate across a geographic area or scale (regions, continents, the world).
cluster_relations.subject_entity_name: new forms and variations of legends
cluster_relations.subject_class_group: Narrative Truth, Sources, and Explanatory Roles
cluster_relations.object_class_label: Geographic Scales of Urban Legend Spread
remarks: Again somewhat inferential but aligned with narrative logic.
Again somewhat inferential but aligned with narrative logic.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: The Hook Man legend circulates in various forms around the world.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that a legend or its variations are present and circulate across a geographic area or scale (regions, continents, the world).
cluster_relations.object_class_label: Geographic Scales of Urban Legend Spread

args.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that a legend, information item, or its variations are disseminated and circulate across a geographic area or scale (e.g., regions, continents, the world).
args.justification: All three relations describe the geographic spread/dissemination of legends or their variants across large spatial scales. They share the same underlying semantic: cultural diffusion of narrative content over space. Normalizing to a single predicate ('spreads_across') and a unified class ('cultural_diffusion_relation') improves schema consistency; 'reaches_scope' and 'is_spread_across' are minor wording variants of the same concept.

executed_decisions.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that a legend, information item, or its variations are disseminated and circulate across a geographic area or scale (e.g., regions, continents, the world).
executed_decisions.justification: All three relations describe the geographic spread/dissemination of legends or their variants across large spatial scales. They share the same underlying semantic: cultural diffusion of narrative content over space. Normalizing to a single predicate ('spreads_across') and a unified class ('cultural_diffusion_relation') improves schema consistency; 'reaches_scope' and 'is_spread_across' are minor wording variants of the same concept.
